tier.description: You have received a text message from headquarters.
Go see Kirsten Geary at Illuminati headquarters.
You have received a text message from headquarters.
Speak with Richard Sonnac in Temple Hall.
Receive your assignment from Richard Sonnac.

cinematic.line: 'Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels,
And prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven.'
Raphael provides inspiration for us all.
A reminder that victory is not only possible, but necessary.
I have a new assignment for you...
Two gentlemen from Oxford - archaeologists - have uncovered an artifact in Egypt.
It's a scroll of some sort, but I'm getting mixed messages regarding it's value.
I need you to go down there and sort it out.
There's more... this find has captured the attention of the higher ups,
much more than is warranted by something this trivial.
There is more to this than meets the eye, and I'm being left out of the loop.
I expect you to fill me in.
Ascertain the true meaning of this discovery, and as always, watch your back.

tier.description: You have received a text message from headquarters.
Travel to the Oxford Camp in The Scorched Desert, Egypt.
Listen to the Oxford archeologists.

cinematic.line: Montgomery: I'm telling you, Arun. This mystery goes deeper. We must learn more!
Arun: There is no mystery! It is a blank piece of papyrus! We have more pressing matters to attend to.
Montgomery: Don't be naive, boy!
Arun: Boy? I am a full-grown man, Monty! You of all people know this to be true!
Montgomery: Er um... we have a visitor, Arun. Important news travels fast, does it not?
Perhaps you can settle the matter for us...
I hold in my hands an ancient artifact,
My young colleague would have you believe it is simply a piece of unused paper stock, but I...
I see a mystery. A piece of history waiting to be uncovered.
Here, take a look for yourself.
Curious... it seems to glow at your touch.
Arun: Look! Something is appearing!

tier.description: The scroll seems to glow, and an image is appearing.
Listen to the Oxford archeologists.

cinematic.line: Montgomery: Remarkable! There is indeed an image, but these old eyes don't see very well.
Arun: The image is distorted, but it appears to be a large tree of some sort.
Montgomery: The course forward is clear... You must take the scroll, and find this location.
Arun: Aren't we going as well?
Montgomery: No. The scroll's destiny lies with our visitor.
We will continue to research this mystery, but our place is here.
Find this tree, and all will be revealed.

tier.description: Take the scroll to the pictured location.
Take the scroll to the pictured location.
The scroll is changing. A message appears, but it is difficult to make out.
The scroll changed. A message appeared, but it is difficult to make out.
The scroll is changing again. A new message appears.
The scroll changed again. A new message appeared.
A new message is appearing on the scroll.
The scroll changed again. A new message appeared.
The scroll changed again. A new message appeared.
Another message is appearing on the scroll. The inscription is very clear.
Another message appeared on the scroll. The inscription is very clear.
Show the scroll to Cucuvea.

cinematic.line: The world always needs saving, doesn't it?
Wouldn't it be nice if it stayed saved, if only for a little while?
Some days, I just don't give a hoot. But nevermind that...
What have you brought me today?
Oh dear. I suppose I shouldn't be surprised to see that again.
You keep hold of that yourself, but I will tell you what I know, or at least what I remember.
It is called The World Scroll. It draws power from the World Tree.
But you already knew that, didn't you?
It's a peculiar device. It doesn't tell you exactly where it wants to go, does it?
Oh, it wants to, desperately, but it can't.
It doesn't know what it needs, only that it needs it.
And now here you are, in my tree.
It's only doing its job, I suppose. All things in due time.
First the awakening, and then the gathering, and then...
Well... 'Your journey has only just begun.' I believe that is the appropriate phrase.
You had better get to it.
I have a world to save.

tier.description: The scroll contains a picture of the tree again.
The scroll contains a picture of the tree again.
A new message appears on the scroll.
A new message appears on the scroll.
A new message appears on the scroll.
A new message appears on the scroll.
A painting appears on the scroll.
A painting appears on the scroll.
A sculpture appears on the scroll.
A sculpture appears on the scroll.
A new image appears on the scroll.
A new image appears on the scroll.
Show the scroll to Mosul.

cinematic.line: You have returned. Shall I tell your story, huh?
I have not forgotten.
From hiding you emerged, hungry and weak.
You gathered close to the Great Tree and were restored.
The designs of man - words, art, music, culture, technology - you devoured them all.
You coveted the mind of an Old One, but the Old Ones are wise.
Unfulfilled, you returned to hibernation.
So the story goes, and so it will go again.
The bridge you seek shall not be crossed. Now go.

tier.description: A photograph appears on the scroll.
A photograph appears on the scroll.
The scroll now displays an image. It vibrates slightly as music emanates from it.
The scroll now displays an image. It vibrates slightly as music emanates from it.
The scroll is changing and displaying a motion picture.
The scroll has changed and is displaying a motion picture.
The scroll is displaying a stage play.
The scroll is displaying a stage play.
A new image appears on the scroll.
A new image appears on the scroll.
Give the scroll to Anastasia.

cinematic.line: Wagon: ...
Anastasia: What they asked of such a young girl was wrong, but I still miss them.
Wagon: ...
Anastasia: Yes, you're my family now, Wagon.
Wagon: ...
Anastasia: Me too, Wagon. Me too.
Oh, hello. What can I do for you?
What's that? Sure, I'll have a look.
This is no ordinary scroll, is it?
I have a way with supposedly 'inanimate' objects.
Oh look, the scroll is changing. It's a picture of you, Wagon...
Wagon: !!!
Anastasia: What? Oh no! Take the scroll back! Please take it and go!
Oh, I'm sorry, Wagon! I didn't see! I didn't see!
It's ok, I'm here. Everything's going to be alright, I promise.
You got what you came for, thief! Now leave!

tier.description: You have received a text message from the Oxford camp.
Return to the Oxford Camp.
Listen to the Oxford archeologists.

cinematic.line: Montgomery: Ah, welcome back. We have learned much since we last spoke.
Listen to this text...
'The Scroll of Aten goes by many names...
The Scroll of Knowledge, The World Scroll, The Devouring Scroll...'
Arun: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy?
Montgomery: Er um... as I was saying...
'The scroll has surfaced multiple times throughout history.
Its possessor is led to special locations.
These serve as touchstones, feeding the scroll with new knowledge and unlocking dormant abilities.
Legend says what it seeks most is to touch the mind of an immortal,
to unlock the secrets of life and death.
Failing in that pursuit, it goes back into hiding,
awakening again, often centuries later, to try again.'
Arun, the other text, please...
Arun: 'And the Scroll of Aten shall gather the knowledge of man,
and it shall discover the path to immortality.
Wholly enlightened, the scroll shall return to its true master...
Look! There is a new symbol on the scroll.
Montgomery: It seems your journey is not yet complete.

tier.description: A new image is revealed on the scroll.
A new image is revealed on the scroll.
The scroll is reacting to the pyramid.
The scroll is changing rapidly.
You have received a text message from headquarters.
Bring the scroll to Jin Jae-Hoon at the Kumiho Hotel in Seoul.
Give the scroll to Jin Jae-Hoon.

cinematic.line: When a bee dies, no one notices, but if the last bee dies...
Is the last death really more significant than the first?
This scroll is quite a find, and to have completed its quest...
There are those that would chastise you for such actions, but we know better.
This is no single pollination. You have thrown seeds into a tempest,
and they will be sewn far and wide.
To predict the reaping... you have given us much to contemplate.
And this scroll, as it is, deserves much study.
Leave it with me, please.
Someone else would like to see you.
Please go to the second floor, end of the hallway.

tier.description: Go to the second floor, end of the hallway.
Meet someone upstairs.

cinematic.line: 'Dduhsi itnuhn kose kiri itda.'
It means 'In a place where there is will, there is a road.'
Your road has led to an unexpected discovery...
A new variable for the equations... A new element on the periodic table, so to speak.
This is very rare.
The models are gods, and now they look upon you with favor.
How long has it been since...
You're still shy.
Come in. Lie down.
This is our way.
Our path...
-- Ecstasy --
-- Clarity --
-- Truth --
-- Chaos --
-- Order --
Let us begin.

tier.description: You have received a text message from headquarters.
Bring the scroll to Leah Cassini at Illuminati headquarters.
Give the scroll to Leah Cassini.

cinematic.line: Oh good, it's here.
Now, I just need to connect the electrodes to the scroll.
Glowing red lights.
Finally, I'll press the blinking Enter button, and...
Oh! We forgot to put bras on our heads.
This isn't Weird Science! That's what I tell the bosses, but do they listen?
I don't know why they send this shit to me.
I know computers, not magic, or whatever cool word we have for 'magic' these days.
Yes, I just said the word 'sigh'. Another one of my adorable idiosyncrasies.
Leave the scroll with me. I'll scan it and data mine it into oblivion.
The boss will have my report when I'm done.

tier.description: Report to Kirsten Geary at Illuminati headquarters.
Listen to Ms. Geary.

cinematic.line: What do you think of my shoes? Aren't they lovely?
The ultimate in fashion, elegance, comfort, and of course, expense.
It's my first pair. A pure joy and worth every penny, I assure you.
I think I'll wear them for the rest of the day...
then it's into the bin like every other pair.
A girl has to maintain her standards.
I was so looking forward to buying a month's supply,
but a blank scroll isn't the same as a blank check, is it?
Next time, maybe bring the scroll to us, before you go all Veronica Mars and solve the case?
An impotent artifact is such a turnoff.
Awwww... I see those little wheels turning in your mind.
That's so sweet, but you couldn't afford these shoes. Trust me.
I tell you what, dear...
Every time my feet hurt for the next month, I will think of you. Deal? Good... and bye.

tier.description: You have received a text message from headquarters.
Bring the scroll to Dame Julia Beatrix Tyburn in Temple Hall.
Give the scroll to Dame Julia Beatrix Tyburn.

cinematic.line: Oh good, you got my message.
These devices are not as smart as they are made out to be.
At my age...
Look at the young lady standing over there.
She is quite striking, isn't she? We all appreciate beauty,
but when you reach a certain age, it is the youth you admire.
The young skin, of course, but moreso the energy... the hope... the naivety.
She has her whole life in front of her.
There are legends, but this scroll...
This blank scroll... it does not seem it could change anything.
Nevertheless, we will thoroughly examine the artifact and keep it safe in our vaults.
Your service is appreciated.

tier.description: Report to Richard Sonnac in Temple Hall.
Debrief with Richard Sonnac.

cinematic.line: I have read the reports. Our best people are examining the scroll,
but they can't get anything out of it.
We may have learned more if you had brought us the scroll while it was activated,
and who knows what events have now been set in motion.
Perhaps it is for the best. Evil comes in many forms.
Even the most wise may succumb to temptation.
Time will tell us how this all plays out.
That is all for now.
We'll be in touch.
